text:
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 07.11.2013, 0,3l bottle sampled @ home:
Clear, slightly straw colored. Aroma is mild, slightly sweet fruity, rice, hay, hints of citrus, well hidden varming aclohol. Taste is slightly sweet grassy, rice, warming alcohol, hay, licorice, hints of citrus. A little harsh mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Review from backlog, bottle reviewed 08/19/2012. Pours clear like water. Aroma is sweet, juicy and fruity, pear prevalent, clean rice finish. Taste follows suit, though not as sweet, interesting vinous character, pungent rice, touch of booze. Medium palate, smooth. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. Clear colour with no head. Aroma is rice, alcohol, citrus, cellar. Flavour is rice, alcohol, citrus, cellar. OK

300 ml bottle. Clear, pale straw yellow with light oily body. Aroma is light acidic, rise, a hint of liquorices and medicines. Flavor is quite alcoholic, fruity, rise and flower with a slightly harsh finish but not in a bad way. Medium body. Nice sake, but just a little bit to much alcohol flavor for my liking.

Bottle 300ml. blue glass.Cristal clear color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate rice, cocous, fruity, white wine notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, rice, alcohol. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. [20110416]

Bottle 300ml @ fonefan
Pours clear as water with no head. Aroma has notes of white wine, rice and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.
Bottle @ Ulfborg Easter Tasting, 2011. Pours clear pale yellow no head. Nose is sweet. Rice, vanilla and alcohol. Warmth . . .

Bottle. The body has a little yellowish tint to the clear body. The aroma has a cellary touch, but is mostly fruity. Apples and a touch of pears. The flavor is much the same, with some rice and a pleasant flowery touch. Something licorice like in the far back of the flavor. Alcohol too of course, imparting a lasting warmth. A pleasant sake, maybe a bit warming, but tasteful. 110416
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear very pale yellow with no head. Flavour is rice, sweet, a little bitter and liquirice.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is pale yellow. Aroma and taste are rice malt and alcohol. Dry finish.

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of yngwie. Pours a pale yellow. Nose is sweet and fruity. Solid body, very sweet rice notes with very refined Sauvignon Blanc notes, amazingly complex. The alcohol is rather downayed. One of the best Sakes Ive ever had. 160411
Blue bottle.Pours clear with slightly yellow tint.Aroma of licorice, yellow apples, rice water and alcohol.Flavor is sweet and waming with some alcohol and licorice.
Taster at their restaurant in Mito. Herbal, spicy aroma, with ginjo-ka evident, plus melon and citrus. Sweet, spicy flavor, pepper and maybe nutmeg, and alcohol. Smooth, sweet, crisp and tasty.
